title: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-Wall St falls on China trade worries
text:
US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-Wall St falls on China trade worries

Stock Markets 5 hours ago (Sep 28, 2019 04:10)

US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-Wall St falls on China trade worries NEW YORK, Sept 27 (Reuters) - U.S. stocks fell on Friday

after Reuters and others reported that the Trump administration

is considering delisting Chinese companies from U.S. stock

exchanges, fueling more worries about the U.S.-China trade war.

The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 68.36 points,

or 0.25%, to 26,822.76, the S&P 500 lost 15.67 points, or

0.53%, to 2,961.95 and the Nasdaq Composite dropped

91.03 points, or 1.13%, to 7,939.63.





US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-Wall St falls on China trade worries
